page.title: 15A RACE HORSE TRAINING STABLE
page.content:
The training stables near Harewood cover 108 acres.The workers include jockeys and 22 stable hands aged 18 to 27. The care,feeding and exercising of the horses occupies 12 hours daily.It costs Â£14 a day to train and keep a horse.There are veterinary fees,and race entry fees ranging between Â£10 and Â£20 a race.Other expenses include special light aluminium plate horse shoes,individual saddles and bridles.
Most of the horses are Irish owned. Most races entered are in the British Isles as the courses and jumps differ on the Continent.A horse will be entered for 7 or 8 races a year.The owners,trainers and jockeys each get a percentage of the prize money.
